titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Swid Powell Scrapbook
titlestmt.author: compiled by Laura Tatum

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 8, 2019 at 08:41

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The scrapbook, created by the housewares design firm Swid Powell, is primarily composed of clippings from various magazines about the firm and the architects commissioned by the firm to design tableware and other decorative objects. Also included are examples of the firm's own brochures and publicity materials.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by Addie Powell. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The binding of the scrapbook was removed during processing for preservation purposes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Swid Powell Scrapbook (MS 1918). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Nan Swid and Addie Powell formed Swid Powell, a housewares firm, in 1982. They commissioned many of the most prominent architects of the day, including Richard Meier, Charles Gwathmey, Robert A. M. Stern, Michael Graves, Robert Venturi and Denise Scott Brown, and Stanley Tigerman, to design tableware for mass production. Many of these iconic pieces and their prototypes are held by major museums and design collections, including the Yale University Art Gallery. The firm ceased production in the mid-1990s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The scrapbook, created by the housewares design firm Swid Powell, is primarily composed of clippings from various magazines about the firm and the architects commissioned by the firm to design tableware and other decorative objects. Also included are examples of the firm's own brochures and publicity materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in the scrapbook were arranged by the creators.

controlaccess.subject: Architect-designed decorative arts -- United States
